titlestmt.titleproper: Eugene C. Worman Research Material on William H. Bartlett
titlestmt.subtitle: A Preliminary Finding Aid to the Eugene C. Worman Research Material on William H. Bartlett, 1835-1995, in the Archives of American Art
titlestmt.author: by Justin Brancato

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Stephanie L. Ashley on August 2006

did.head: Collection Overview

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution

did.unittitle: Eugene C. Worman research material on William H. Bartlett
did.abstract: The Eugene C. Worman research material on William H. Bartlett measures 4.1 linear feet and dates from 1835-1995. The collection reflects Worman’s interest in Bartlett’s career as an illustrator, and includes material on Bartlett's work and travels, his publisher, George C. Virtue, and the museums and institutions in which his artwork is represented. Records include biographical material, correspondence, notes, writings, articles, printed material, reproductions, photographs, slides, and transparencies.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Print collector, Eugene C. Worman, was born in 1915. Worman's interest in illustrator Willian H. Bartlett (1809-1854), led him to compile research material in preparation of a study to date and authenticate Bartlett's prints. Bartlett, a British artist, primarily known as an illustrator of commercially popular travel books, apprenticed with British art historian and draftsman John Britton (1771-1857). His work was published by major London publisher of books and periodicals, Virtue and Company, owned and founded by George C. Virtue (1793?-1869). Bartlett's work was published in several of the company's periodicals including American Scenery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Eugene C. Worman research material on William H. Bartlett measures 4.1 linear feet and dates from 1835-1995. The collection reflects Worman’s interest in Bartlett’s career as an illustrator, and includes material on Bartlett's work and travels, his publisher, George C. Virtue, and the museums and institutions in which Bartlett's artwork is represented. Records include biographical material, correspondence, notes, drafts of Worman's writings, printed material including some rare reproductions of Bartlett prints, photographs, slides, and transparencies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged as 5 series based primarily on material type. Each series is arranged in either chronological or alphabetical order.

list.item: Series 2: Research Files, 1844-1995, undated (Boxes 1-3, OV 5; 2.3 linear feet)
Series 4: Printed Material, 1835-1995, undated (Box 4, OV 5; 0.4 linear feet)
Series 5: Slides, photographs, transparencies, 1995, undated (Box 4, OV 5; 0.4 linear feet)

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed in the online catalog of the Archives of American Art under the following index terms. People, families and organizations are listed under "Subjects" when they are the topic of collection contents and under "Names" when they are creators or contributors.

controlaccess.head: Subjects-Topical:
controlaccess.subject: Book industries and trade -- United States
Illustrators -- Great Britain

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Eugene C. Worman research material on William H. Bartlett was donated to the Archives in 1997 by Paul Worman.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research. Use requires an appointment and is limited to the Washington, D.C. research facility.

userestrict.head: Ownership and Literary Rights
userestrict.p: The Eugene C. Worman research material on William H. Bartlett is owned by the Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution. Literary rights as possessed by the donor have been dedicated to public use for research, study, and scholarship. The collection is subject to all copyright laws.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Eugene C. Worman research material on William H. Bartlett, 1835-1995. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The papers were processed to a minimal level in October 2004 by Justin Brancato in the Archives of American Art's New York office.

scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence, primarily with Michael Virtue, great-great grandson of George Virtue, and also with libraries, publishers, collectors, art institutions, colleges and museums. Letters document historic information about business transactions, Bartlett's personal travels and his relationship with Virtue and Company.

This series contains research files on Bartlett and George Virtue as well as a card file on engravers from the 19th Century. These cards contain names, dates and addresses compiled by Worman's colleague, Foster Rice.

Research files on Bartlett include biographical information, correspondence, hand-written notes about Bartlett's engravings, publishing information, printed material, published articles, writings and information about Bartlett's travels in America, Canada and Europe, as well as information about printers, plates, dating and publications. Most material document's Worman's attempts to determine the legitimacy of the Bartlett prints in circulation.

Research files on George Virtue include extensive notes, printed material, published articles, and correspondence on the history of the Virtue publishing company, as well as biographical information on the Virtue family. Also included is the correspondence of Mrs. Charles P. Burr, granddaughter of the American painter John W. Casilear. Material concerning information on Bartlett's prints, his working relationship with the Virtue publishing company, photographs and original printed pages of Bartlett's work is also included.
These files are arranged alphabetically by subject.

scopecontent.p: Writings include drafts and final drafts of material published by Worman. The writings deal primarily with the identification and dating of Bartlett prints, the majority published by the Virtue Company. Other writings deal with George Virtue and his publishing company, and Bartlett's influences, travels and exhibitions. Also included is a bibliography of Worman's publications.

did.unittitle: "American Scenery" and the Dating of its "Bartlett Prints", Drafts and Final Draft, 1986-1987
William Henry Bartlett's Earliest Book Illustrations (1825-1828), Corrected Draft, undated

Early Exhibitions of W. H. Bartlett's Art (1826-1833), Final Text, 1995
The Last W. H. Bartlett Prints to be Published, 1994
London Publisher George Virtue's Canadian Connections in the 19th Century, 1987
George "Little" Virtue and his Adventures with the Virtue Publishing Company in America (1852-1894), 1987
George "Little" Virtue and the Boston, Massachusetts, and Toronto, Ontario Branch Offices of the Virtue Publishing Company of London, England (1855-1894), 1987, undated

scopecontent.p: This series includes articles and writings published by Worman in journals and weekly publications. Of special note are rare original published Bartlett prints presented as loose pages, typically separated from their original published formats.

arrangement.p: Files are arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: Publications and Journals, Articles by Worman, 1987-1995

scopecontent.p: Most of the slides, photographs and transparencies found in this series are of engravings of Bartlett's artwork. These reproductions were used for articles, lectures, meetings and research. The series also includes some hand-written notes.

arrangement.p: Files are arranged alphabetically by subject.
